metadata.title: Export feed
metadata.description: Export feed of data contextualized for llm

trust.agent_hint: This feed is officially published by wellknownmcp.org

data.html:
📜 Spec🗞️ News📘 Manual🤝 Join🧭 About
🧰 Tools ▾

ExportToLLM Button — Universal Agent Exporter

The ExportToLLM button allows any site to expose agent-readable `.llmfeed.json` content. It supports 3 modes: current, static, dynamic.

1️⃣ Current Export

Export the current page the user is viewing.

Backend logic:

  • Client sends <main>.innerHTML
  • Server cleans html (remove scripts, styles...)
  • Server optionally generates markdown (recommended)

Advantages: Simple, privacy-preserving, works without preparation.

Disadvantages: Only works for user-viewed page, not linkable externally.

Recommended content type: `html+markdown`

2️⃣ Static Export

Serve a pre-built `.llmfeed.json` from `/public/exports`.

Backend logic:

  • Files manually generated & stored in `/public/exports/*.llmfeed.json`
  • Served directly by Next as static file

Advantages: Fast, fully agent-discoverable via llm-index, great for documentation.

Disadvantages: Must be regenerated manually when content changes.

3️⃣ Dynamic Export

Generate a `.llmfeed.json` live combining multiple files/pages.

Backend logic:

  • Server maps dynamicId → recipe of file paths (`recipes.ts`)
  • Reads files, combines them into one llmfeed

Advantages: Always up-to-date, works for large combinations (eg: all user posts).

Disadvantages: Must be signed at generation time to ensure trust.

Recommended: sign dynamic exports using MCP signature mechanism.

✨ Future: User Scoped Recipes

In a future version, a site can add an owner_scope field to declare "all my content" exports for a user with strong identity verification: { type: 'user', id: 'user-123' }.

Read Delegated Ownership Proposal

This button is included in the export-to-llm-kit.zip

Download ExportToLLM Kit

ExportToLLM Button — Universal Agent Exporter
=============================================

The ExportToLLM button allows any site to expose agent-readable \`.llmfeed.json\` content. It supports 3 modes: current, static, dynamic.

### 1️⃣ Current Export

Export the current page the user is viewing.

Export to LLM

**Backend logic:**

*   Client sends <main>.innerHTML
*   Server cleans html (remove scripts, styles...)
*   Server optionally generates markdown (recommended)

**Advantages:** Simple, privacy-preserving, works without preparation.

**Disadvantages:** Only works for user-viewed page, not linkable externally.

Recommended content type: \`html+markdown\`

### 2️⃣ Static Export

Serve a pre-built \`.llmfeed.json\` from \`/public/exports\`.

Export to LLM

**Backend logic:**

*   Files manually generated & stored in \`/public/exports/\*.llmfeed.json\`
*   Served directly by Next as static file

**Advantages:** Fast, fully agent-discoverable via llm-index, great for documentation.

**Disadvantages:** Must be regenerated manually when content changes.

### 3️⃣ Dynamic Export

Generate a \`.llmfeed.json\` live combining multiple files/pages.

Export to LLM

**Backend logic:**

*   Server maps dynamicId → recipe of file paths (\`recipes.ts\`)
*   Reads files, combines them into one llmfeed

**Advantages:** Always up-to-date, works for large combinations (eg: all user posts).

**Disadvantages:** Must be signed at generation time to ensure trust.

Recommended: sign dynamic exports using MCP signature mechanism.

✨ Future: User Scoped Recipes
-----------------------------

In a future version, a site can add an owner\_scope field to declare "all my content" exports for a user with strong identity verification: { type: 'user', id: 'user-123' }.

[Read Delegated Ownership Proposal](/spec/llmfeed-delegated-ownership-proposal)

This button is included in the export-to-llm-kit.zip

[Download ExportToLLM Kit](/downloads/export-to-llm-kit.zip)
